text: I'm Jay Shriver a sports editor at The
New York Times I grew up a short walk
from Shea Stadium and have been
attending Mets games ever since the
stadium opened in 1964 my walk to Shea
went past the junkyards that lead right
up to the stadium
the art seemed like an appropriate
metaphor for a stadium that despite its
flaws has a perverse kind of child
and as Shane years at saying I decided
to visit this in perfect structure one
last time
an architect designed it and no no no
offense of the architect but it's always
seemed like the kind of thing that a kid
would have designed you know in a
drawing in the fifth grade or something
this is really the way the outside of
Shea looked all these years there was
nothing ever really else to do except

things with Jay it was just sort of
functional without much imagination or

I think back to is 1986 the world
